properties.name: 103 Fresh Pond Parkway, Cambridge, MA
properties.description: Posted by Westsidebubble103 Fresh Poind Parkway, Cambridge, MAPrice 75,000 Sold Price 27,000 Sold Date 01/31/2006 Assessed Value: 77,900 On market for a very long time. On a busy/loud street, pretty small house in need of serious updating.

properties.name: 114 Washington Ave
properties.description: Posted by Westsidebubble114 Washington Ave, Cambridge, MAPrice ,450,000 Sold Price ,395,000 Assessed Value ,729,800 (previously assessed value ,925,000) Sold Date 03/10/2006 Fantastic House, in poor condition. Two years ago it might have been worth 1.73M. 1.4M is probably a fair price. Assessment is out of line with market in this case.

properties.description: Posted by WestsidebubbleList Price 29,000 Sale Price 50,000 Orig List Price 49,000 Tax Assessed at 75,200 On market for a year. Was in bad shape, but these sorts of places were selling well 2-3 years ago to developers.

properties.name: 25 Maple Ave, Cambridge, MA
properties.description: Posted by Westsidebubble25 Maple Ave, Cambridge, MAPrice 95,000 Sold Price 20,500 Sold Date 06/23/2006 Days on Market 101 days Assessed Value: 51,100 Previous Assessed Value: 87,000 Sale History 06/12/2003: 99,000 11/30/2000: 95,000 The seller actually lost money on the deal from 2003 - 2006 if you include realtor fee and factor in inflation, and list price was below assessed value. This is a strange one, though. Final sale was 5K over asking after 101 DOM? I don\'t get it. It was listed for less than the previous sale, which should give you an indication of what the market is like in Cambridge.

properties.name: 264 Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA
properties.description: Posted by Westsidebubble264 Huron Ave, Cambridge, MAPrice 69,000 (original list more like 50K?) Sold Price 30,000 Sold Date 07/18/2006 Assessed Value: 58,300 Previous Assessed Value: ,259,400* * Cambridge really screwed up assessments in 2005. Some homes, such as this one, were way over-assessed. The lower assessment is likely due to an abatement. This place has been "tastefully updated", which means some woodwork restoration, painting, etc, but kitchens and baths are circa 1950 (or original). A cool house, but not much lot/yard to speak of. Was on the market for a loooooooong time. (maybe on-off again?)

properties.name: 28 Arlington St, Cambridge

Maybe the "low price" will spark some interest.

properties.name: 62 Kinnaird St, Cambridge, MA
properties.description: Posted by Westsidebubble62 Kinnaird St, Cambridge, MAPrice 99,000 Sold Price 60,000 Sold Date 07/18/2006 Assessed Value: 74,700 Previous Sale Price: 40,000 Previous Sale Date: April 14, 2000 About 18% increase over six years. Seems like an ok price for a good size single family house in Cambridge. I used to play in the park/parking lot nearby when I was a kid. Not a particulary nice neighborhood. Note: picture is old, house has been painted since (looks much better ;-))
